page.title: 19Southend:Bank Holidays
page.content: {Southend's Bank Holiday Mondays have a reputation throughout the country and often make front page news in the Natonal Press the following day. On the Bank holiday all the groups such as the Mods,Casuals,Skinheads and Rockers descend on Southend,in particular onto the Seafront,and have large riots or fights,often with the police. The children interviewed some of these groups.The casuals said that they often spent Â£30 on shoes,and over Â£150 on complete outfits.They especially wear clothes with expensive brand names. The Town is often vandalised by these groups on Bank Holiday Mondays and British Rail lay on special trains for the groups to travel into Southend.
